oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Correlated polaron transport and metal-insulator transition in La(1-x)SrxMnO(3)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SRIVASTAVA, NB
SINGH, LN
SRIVASTAVA, CM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: giant magnetoresistance
double-exchange
la1-xsrxmno3
manganites
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The transport behavior of La(1-x)Sr(x)MnO(3) in the antiferromagnetic insulator, ferromagnetic insulator, and ferromagnetic metallic phases is shown to follow from the correlated polaron mechanism and a single transport equation accounts for the temperature dependence of resistivity for 0 <= x <= 0.40 in the 0-400 K range. In the low temperature range zero-point lattice vibration plays a dominant role in the transport in the metallic phase. (C) 2009 American Institute of Physics. [DOI: 10.1063/1.3055283]
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 53rd Annual Conference on Magnetism and Magnetic Materials,Austin, TX,NOV 11-14, 2008
